titleStmt.title: Partial Manuscripts Schema, constrained for usage in XForms
titleStmt.author: Maximilian de Molière
Pietro Liuzzo
Nathan Gibson

publicationStmt.authority: Institut für den Nahen und Mittleren Osten
publicationStmt.publisher: ERC-funded project: MAJLIS. The Transformation of Jewish Literature in Arabic in the Islamicate World

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

revisionDesc.change: Created schema on basis of Arabic Manuscripts Schema created by Pietro Liuzzo

div.head: Information on this customization
div.p: Schema for MAJLIS Project. This part of the schema is used for entering descriptions of the manuscript binding using XForms.
Built on the Beta maṣāḥǝft Guidelines contain examples and details of that customization.
Added Rules from the consolidated schema of FIRHIST
Constrained this schema for generating forms.

moduleRef.except: abbr add addrLine address analytic author bibl biblScope biblStruct binaryObject cb choice cit citedRange corr date del desc distinct divGen editor ellipsis email emph expan foreign gap gb gloss graphic head headItem headLabel hi imprint index item l label lb lg list listBibl measure measureGrp media meeting mentioned milestone monogr name noteGrp num orig pb postBox postCode ptr pubPlace publisher q quote rb ref reg relatedItem resp respStmt rs rt ruby said series sic soCalled sp speaker stage street teiCorpus term textLang time title unclear unit

elementSpec.desc: Describe the writing material. Choose from the list what kind of material is used in the manuscript/this codicological unit.
Fill in the date in the agreed-upon calendrical system. Use the "when" attribute for precise values. In case the date can only be approximated, use the "notAfter"and "notBefore" attributes together.

Look up the place records in the database to specify the location where the manuscript or manuscript part was produced. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. (The "ref" attribute will be filled out automatically when you link a place record to this element.)
The height of the binding, measured in millimeters.
The width of the binding, measured in millimeters.
Enter prose text to connect the fields dedicated to specific elements and form a coherent descriptive text.

Description of the material, dimensions, and preservation of the binding. Specify in the attribute if the binding is contemporary to the manuscript's production or not with the values "true" or "false".
Container element for description of the binding.
Describe the manuscript’s decoration. Choose the "type" from the list.

valItem.desc: an ornament around the page
An independent illustration in colour that occupies the full-page or part of the equivalent space of one or more columns of text.
A border that surrounds a text or image and may occupy the margins and intercolumnar space. Typically used to mark the beginning of a new text or section of text.

A decorative border that surrounds a text and may occupy the margins and intercolumnar space. Typically used to mark the beginning of a new text or section of text. With two specifications, for Band (single border) and Frame (border encompassing multiple sides of text)
Decorative frame encompassing all four sides of the text and may occupy the margins and intercolumnar space. Typically used to mark the beginning of a new text or section of text.
Single decorative border that surrounds a text and may occupy the margins and intercolumnar space. Typically used to mark the beginning of a new text or section of text.
crude drawings which do not belong to the primary strata of the manuscript (already encoded as “extras”)
A monochrome or bichrome image that is not painted.
A drawing that conveys information or knowledge in schematic form.
An enlarged letter at the beginning of a text of paragraph that features figurative or decorative motifs.
A small miniature painted next to one of the margins of the text.
An image on paper created with a printing plate.
A printed image, usually of devotional character, glued to a manuscript
to be used in binding description
to be used in binding description
to be used in binding description
to be used in binding description
to be used in binding description
to be used in binding description
to be used in binding description
to be used in binding description
to be used in binding description. Materials of which the binding is made.
to be used in binding description. Endband at the head end of the spine of a book.
for use in binding description. Endband at the tail end of the spine of a book.

for use in binding description. Structural and decorative elements of the binding which are found at the head and tail of the spine of a book. The ethiopian endbands are usually slit-braid stripes of leather or link-stitch sewings.
for use in binding description. Stripe of different form and material used to keep closed a book. Traces of fastenings can be holes and pins on the outer edge of the boards.
for use in binding description. The part of the book opposite the fore-edge.
for use in binding description. Portable leather case with attached slip where the manuscript is kept.
for use in binding description. Components made from one or more pieces of material (usually wood) used to protect and support a bookblock.
for use in binding description. Sewing stations are created by passing a thread through a spine fold when sewing a book.
for use in binding description. All the leaves found at each side of a bookblock, intended to give protection to the text leaves.
The material that constitutes the immediate covering of the completed binding.

elementSpec.desc: The depth of the binding, measured in millimeters.
